```{r setup}
# Global chunk options
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  echo = FALSE,
  warning = FALSE,
  message = FALSE,
  error = FALSE,

  fig.height = 8,

)

# Load data

```

## Performance Gauges

Gauge charts display KPIs with color bands for quick status assessment.
These use the new `show_when` comparison operators (`>=`, `<=`).

### Overall Engagement

```{r overall-engagement}
# Overall Engagement
result <- viz_gauge(
  data = data,
  title = "Overall Engagement",
  value = 73,
  data_labels_format = "{y}%",
  color = "#4E79A7",
  bands = list(list("from" = 0, "to" = 40, "color" = "#E15759"), list("from" = 40, "to" = 70, "color" = "#F28E2B"), list("from" = 70, "to" = 100, "color" = "#59A14F")),
  target = 80,
  target_color = "#333"
)

# Enable chart export button
if (inherits(result, 'highchart')) {
  result <- highcharter::hc_exporting(result, enabled = TRUE)
}

result <- dashboardr:::.embed_cross_tab(result)

result
```

### Employee Retention Rate

```{r employee-retention-rate}
# Employee Retention Rate
result <- viz_gauge(
  data = data,
  title = "Employee Retention Rate",
  value = 88,
  data_labels_format = "{y}%",
  color = "#59A14F",
  min = 0,
  max = 100
)

# Enable chart export button
if (inherits(result, 'highchart')) {
  result <- highcharter::hc_exporting(result, enabled = TRUE)
}

result <- dashboardr:::.embed_cross_tab(result)

result
```

### Avg Rating (out of 5)

```{r avg-rating-out-of-5}

  max = 5,
  color = "#F28E2B"
)

}

result <- dashboardr:::.embed_cross_tab(result)

result
```
